thread.title: Building on fire at honey company in Leeston, firefighters trying to protect nearby homes
thread.title_full: Building on fire at honey company in Leeston, firefighters trying to protect nearby homes

title: Building on fire at honey company in Leeston, firefighters trying to protect nearby homes
text:
Building on fire at honey company in Leeston, firefighters trying to protect nearby homes Last updated 22:37,   
Multiple fire engines have been called to a blaze in Leeston, Canterbury. 
Multiple fire engines are responding to a large blaze in Leeston, near Christchurch, on Tuesday night. 
Fire Service spokesman Andrew Norris said a building at Airborne Honey on Pennington St was "well involved" in flames. 
Can you see the fire? Send your pictures and video to 
Firefighters were attempting to protect homes near the building. 
Four fire trucks, two water tankers and a command unit had been called to the fire. 
More soon.
